news.title: Q3.2022 Review from MetaMask Institutional
news.subtitle: An end-of-quarter message from MetaMask Institutional's Global Product Lead, Johann Bornman.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
‚ÄúYour work is to discover your work and then with all your heart to give yourself to it.‚Äù ‚Äì Buddha

Hello Friends, Funds, and DAOs,

Over the past two quarters, a consistent theme in these updates has been the volatile macroeconomic, geopolitical and crypto environment. And while Q3 continued the trend, Crypto‚Äôs volatility appears to have been matched and outdone by many G8 bond markets and currencies. ‚ÄúMay you live in interesting times‚Äù, the apocryphal saying goes. Interesting times indeed. While the traditional world repeats its old boom and bust, inflation and deflation cycles, we within Crypto aim to build a new and better system. Arguably, one of the most significant steps to bring this new system to fruition occurred in Q3, as Ethereum moved from Proof of Work to Proof of Stake. The upgrade was one of the many bright lights in Web3, another reason to be profoundly confident about the future of our ecosystem.

Bear markets are essential periods to build, and MetaMask Institutional‚Äôs (MMI) goal has been to stand on ceremony. Hence, our focus for the quarter was to lay the necessary foundations that allow us to be and continue to be a bright light within Web3. For those reading this circular for the first time, it is MMI‚Äôs mission to bridge every organization on earth into Web3. We believe Web3 is eating the world; therefore, we provide and will continue to provide unrivaled access to it. Regardless of the interface, API or key management solution an institution needs. Hence, we think deeply about the infrastructure, tools, features and products required to achieve this. Our quarter, in summary, is a reflection of these values.

Acquisition, Engagement and Retention

In Q3, we announced our next set of custodian partners, bringing our total custodian partners to 11 globally. We now offer the most expansive suite of custodial integrations on the market, ensuring unrivaled access to custody and different key management solutions in different jurisdictions. Thus, regardless of the allocation strategy, crypto asset, or network an organization has or needs access to, we can cater to an organization‚Äôs needs. In Q3, we grew our onboarded organizations by 26%, the assets deployed using MMI by 85% and our annual recurring revenue by 400%.

Extension and Custodian Integrations

The MMI extension is the frontier experience that provides unrivaled access to all of Web3. And despite the bear market, we continue to see incredibly healthy engagement and more than double industry standard retention metrics. We have been deeply fortunate to see double-digit week-on-week assets deployed growth throughout this year. Hence, we took the time within the last 90 days to lay more extensive infrastructure to cater to the continued wave of users.

We‚Äôve started to document milestones within MMI‚Äôs product development on our change log. Take a look.

Explore Change Log

Portfolio Dashboard

Throughout the quarter, we shipped a range of updates and essential features. We rolled out improved versions of our reporting capabilities, portfolio snapshots, and NFT views. Within an organization‚Äôs NFT holding, we now provide a variety of historical and real-time valuation data points for an NFT. As I have written in past updates, we follow strict product and design principles within MMI and focus on identifying Tier-1 user needs. Hence, prioritizing building painkillers over vitamins. In product vocabulary, the latter are small features that can and should delight a user. In contrast, the former solves the most critical and pressing needs. We also do a lot of work to strategically layer our features to ensure they build on top of one another and open up adjacent capabilities. Hence, our vitamin features often lead to painkillers. Throughout the quarter, we implemented a few vitamins throughout the portfolio dashboard. From improved visual layouts and charts to allowing filtering for dust tokens, currency settings, and a general settings sections. These vitamins are laying the foundation for two crucial initiatives (and painkillers) that we aim to ship in Q4 and Q1. In Q3, we saw our portfolio dashboard engagement metrics increase by 160% and 8-week retention metrics by 51%.

We believe the standard for an organization dashboard is incredibly high, and there are so many essential updates we still want to release to meet these standards. However, we are excited about the significant features rolling out in the quarters ahead. Our portfolio dashboard offers a curated institutional experience‚Äîthe dashboard connects all custodians, accounts, networks, and assets in one place‚Äîseamlessly working with the MMI wallet. Hence, we are doing a lot of work to define what we think the institutional user experience should be‚Äîboth in viewing portfolios and allocating to different digital assets.

Programmatic Access

As more diverse organizations access Web3, API access (over UI) is often a fundamental demand. As we work towards being the unrivaled bridge into Web3, we have been doing a lot of work to ensure that regardless of the execution method of an organization, we can cater to their needs. Within Q3, we open-sourced a Python version of MMI‚Äôs SDK. The MMI SDK is effectively the connector to which all our custodian partners integrate. Clients of MMI and our custodian partners can now quickly build programmatic python scripts and connect to our SDK. Allowing for programmatic transaction creations. This capability will enable organizations to execute programmatically across multiple different custodians. We have many plans for this feature and will build out this library to make crafting different execution strategies as simple as possible. With Programmatic Access, we extend MMI‚Äôs access to Web3 through an additional interface.

Conclusion

The quarter saw many vital milestones for MMI. From our custodian announcement, integrations, and continued growth to new and improved features‚ÄîWe have laid essential foundations to deliver, what we believe, will be game-changing features in the quarters ahead. We live for our users and are building a product they not only love, but also can‚Äôt live without. For those on this circular that are users of MMI, we no doubt have spoken with you, and we look forward to speaking with you again. To all, we can‚Äôt wait to show you what MMI has in-store over the quarters ahead.

Sincerely,

__Johann Bornman

Global Product Lead, MetaMask Institutional

news.metaDescription: Ensuring MetaMask is safe, secure, and stable enough for continued viral growth | Q3.2022

nodes.title: Transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available in MetaMask
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.

image.title: Centralized exchange transfers MetaMask now available
image.description: Centralized exchange transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available on MetaMask.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask Portfolio now supports centralized exchange (CEX) transfers from Coinbase and Binance, streamlining the process of transferring assets to your crypto wallet.

Many web3 users have digital assets divided across multiple wallets and accounts, creating a fragmented experience. Moving assets from one platform to another can be overly complicated and involve many steps‚Äîfraught with the risks of copying and pasting addresses incorrectly, and potential security concerns. MetaMask‚Äôs new CEX transfer feature is a solution to this issue, making your wallet more powerful, while also strengthening security.

Instant transfer of assets from centralized exchanges into your MetaMask wallet

MetaMask CEX transfers allow you to immediately move assets between accounts, eliminating the need for manually entering addresses. And, if you have bank accounts linked to your Coinbase or Binance accounts, purchasing crypto directly with your bank account to your MetaMask wallet has never been easier. No additional KYC necessary.

In April 2024, MetaMask partnered with Meld and Mesh to launch a feature that allowed users to track external CEX balances by linking Coinbase or Binance accounts directly from the MetaMask Portfolio dashboard. Now, you can view CEX balances, and also transfer assets from these exchanges into your MetaMask wallet. Neither MetaMask, nor our partners in this integration, will ever have access to your exchange login credentials, or share your wallet addresses with third parties.

CEX transfers will initially support Coinbase or Binance accounts, with expansion to additional exchanges on the horizon. No fees will be charged when transferring digital assets from exchanges to MetaMask. A nominal transaction fee of 0.25% will be applied when transferring from MetaMask to centralized exchanges. Network gas fees also apply.

By bridging the gap between self-custodial and centralized platforms, MetaMask is paving the way for a more powerful, integrated, and user-friendly DeFi ecosystem. Head to MetaMask Portfolio today to get started with CEX transfers.

nodes.metaDescription: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.

nodes.title: How gamers are empowered in web3
nodes.subtitle: Discover the builders who are transforming web3, in our More With MetaMask Partner Series.

image.title: More With MetaMask Partner Series Yooldo
image.description: More With MetaMask Partner Series Yooldo gaming

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask is the gateway to the decentralized web, enabling you to do more. Users can connect to any dapp, on any network, from any device. From DeFi to DeSci, gaming to NFTs, and beyond: MetaMask is passionate about the web3 community. The More With MetaMask Partner Series shines a light on builders who are innovating across web3. For Yooldo ‚Äì a gaming community focused on security and autonomy ‚Äì¬†MetaMask is essential.

A new era of web3 gaming

In traditional online gaming, players' assets are controlled by the developer or publisher, and stored on centralized servers. This setup leaves users at risk of losing access to their digital items, which can happen for various reasons including a company modifying its policies, or shutting down the game. In web3 gaming, players have full ownership of their digital assets, independent of the game itself. This decentralization ensures that Yooldo gamers have complete control over their assets, with no monolithic authority able to restrict access or manipulate users‚Äô holdings.

How MetaMask keeps gaming assets safe

With self-custody comes gamers' responsibility for maintaining safety of their own assets. The decentralized security that MetaMask offers is vital for Yooldo gamers. Users have control over their private keys, which means that even in the case of a data breach, gaming assets will remain secure. All actions on Yooldo are also transparent and traceable ‚Äì whether purchasing an in-game asset, or interacting with the platform. And, each transaction requires user approval, via blockchain‚Äôs cryptographic validation and consensus protocols.

Another critical feature that safeguards users is phishing protection, powered by MetaMask and ChainPatrol‚Äôs Eth-Phishing-Protect. MetaMask provides in-app warnings, and domain verification systems to protect users from dubious links and attacks. This allows Yooldo gamers to be alerted to potentially malicious websites quickly and efficiently.

Empowering gamers through decentralization

As the web3 ecosystem grows, security is of the utmost importance. Gamers can store, buy, sell, and trade their in-game assets directly, without worrying about data breaches, server failures, or third-party interference. More broadly, MetaMask enables players to transfer assets between different games, or wider marketplaces. Digital gaming assets earned in Yooldo can be sold or traded for tokens with real-world value, extending their utility beyond gameplay. No matter where you are in your web3 gaming journey, MetaMask continues to offer more ways to stay secure.

Ready to dive into web3 gaming? Head to Yooldo to get started.

nodes.title: MetaMask now compatible with NGRAVE hardware wallet
nodes.subtitle: For a more secure self-custody experience.

image.title: MetaMask hardware wallet integration NGRAVE
image.description: MetaMask now has hardware wallet integration with NGRAVE

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask has announced its integration with NGRAVE on Extension and Mobile, enhancing security of users‚Äô digital assets. By leveraging both MetaMask hot wallet and NGRAVE ZERO hardware wallet, users can benefit from convenience and accessibility, while maintaining the highest levels of security.

Increased security

Because hardware wallets are offline, they significantly reduce the risk of being hacked, and unauthorized access to users‚Äô private keys. Hardware wallets, sometimes called ‚Äúcold wallets‚Äù also serve as a secure backup for private keys, ensuring that primary assets remain safe even if the hot wallet is compromised. Since users retain total control over their private keys, the integration expands self-custody management of their crypto assets. Additionally, as hardware wallets are online by default, MetaMask stays up-to-date with alerts, to minimize the risk of phishing attacks and malware that typically target hot wallets.

Convenience and accessibility

Users can quickly access and manage their funds through their MetaMask hot wallet, allowing them to buy, sell, transfer, bridge, stake, and more ‚Äì while signing fully offline via their hardware wallet. This avoids compromising the security of larger holdings stored in the hardware wallet. MetaMask wallet allows for seamless transactions, without moving assets between different wallets frequently. A streamlined integration between hot and cold wallets provides a smoother user experience, making it easier for novice and experienced users to manage their assets versatile and securely.

Note: for the MetaMask browser extension, the minimum required version to use the NGRAVE integration is v. 12.3.0. For the MetaMask app, the minimum required version is v. 7.31.1.

How to use MetaMask with NGRAVE



Sync MetaMask with NGRAVE ZERO

  1. On your ZERO, go to Settings ‚Üí Sync ‚Üí MetaMask. This will display a QR code.
  2. In MetaMask, go to Account Selector ‚Üí Add Account Or Hardware Wallet ‚Üí Add Hardware Wallet.
  3. Click QR-based ‚Üí Continue ‚Äì this will open the camera.
  4. Scan the QR code on your ZERO by holding it in front of your webcam or phone camera.
  5. MetaMask will show a list of the ETH accounts on your ZERO. (Note: This list will contain all ETH addresses for your wallet, regardless of how many you already had created on ZERO.) Select which wallet addresses you want to have available via MetaMask.
  6. MetaMask will now show your ZERO accounts that you have synced.
  7. If you want to add or remove accounts in MetaMask, repeat this process.

Transact with MetaMask and NGRAVE ZERO



Make a transaction request in MetaMask

  1. Open MetaMask Extension in your browser, and select the NGRAVE account of your choice.
  2. Click Send, and select the token and the amount you would like to send. Then, enter your destination address.
  3. Click Continue. This will show you the transaction details. Make sure they are correct. Consider making a screenshot or a note of the transaction details. By the time ZERO will show you the details for verification, MetaMask will no longer display them.
  4. When you are ready, click Confirm.

Scan the QR code generated by MetaMask with ZERO

  1. On ZERO, tap on the blue scan icon in the right top of the dashboard, or tap on the coin you want to send funds from and tap Send. This will open the camera on your ZERO for you to scan the MetaMask QR code.

Verify the transaction before signing it with ZERO

  1. ZERO will display all the transaction details. Verify the transaction details on your ZERO screen. It is essential to make sure that they match the details you entered in MetaMask. In some cases, the transaction can't be decoded or part of the decoded transaction can't be interpreted. Make sure you understand the risks of blind signing and take appropriate measures to protect your funds. Find out more about staying safe in Web3.
  2. If everything is correct, sign the transaction request offline with your PIN. If required by your settings, you will be asked for your fingerprint.
  3. You will now see the signed transaction in the form of a QR code on your ZERO.

Scan the QR code generated by ZERO with MetaMask

  1. In Metamask, click Get Signature to open your computer's camera.
  2. Scan the NGRAVE ZERO signature QR code with MetaMask. The image of the QR code will appear blurred for security reasons. It will not affect the reading.

Success! ü¶ä

Learn more about how you can enjoy MetaMask's features with NGRAVE's hardwallet integration in MetaMask's Hardware Wallet Hub, and get started.

nodes.metaDescription: MetaMask has announced its integration with NGRAVE on Extension and Mobile, enhancing security of users‚Äô digital assets.
